comments:
Several command/contexts are failing as a result of your latest checkin (the big
one, not the fix).  Any context that isn't defined in XML is being pruned from
the activated list.  The stack traces:

I think the problem is in Workbench.contextManagerListener.  When the active
contexts change this listener is hit and it's pruning out all contexts that dont
have a parent via workbenchContextSupport.createFilteredContextTreeFor() and
passing the result to workbenchCommandSupport.setActiveContextIds.  This in turn
is again calling contextManager.setActiveContextIds(activeContextIds.keySet()); 

I'm going to try and sort this out for the I build.
Note that hte last comment applied to the context failure, not the command failures.

For the context failure: 

simply remove the contextManagerListener from Workbench.  It doesn't do anything
useful anymore.

For the command failures:

Our handler assigning code never unsets handlers.  This used to be done in
MutableCommandHandlers but similar behaviour is not done in CommandManagerWrapper.

We can fix this in WorkbenchCommandSupport.processHandlerSubmissions by putting
commands without handlers into handlersByCommandId with a null handler instead
of ommitting them.  In CommandManagerWrapper we check for the null case and set
the handler to null.
Patch reviewed with Nick and submitted to HEAD for the I rebuild.

I agree with both patches.  I've cleaned them up a bit.  Marking this bug as 
fixed....
These tests did not fail in I20050215-2300.

traces.message: When a dialog is open, it should not fall back to the active workbench window.
The MockViewPart command should not be handled
The MockViewPart context should be enabled
